intro: Brachystegia mpalensis var. latifoliolata, commonly known as the broad-leafed brachystegia, is a deciduous tree native to the miombo woodlands of eastern and southern Africa. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and has a broad, spreading crown. The leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a distinctive broad leaflet arrangement. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It is valued for its hard, durable wood and plays an important role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat.
